basics.name: Jonathan Phillips
basics.label: DevOps & Infrastructure Leader
basics.summary: DevOps leader with 25+ years of experience driving infrastructure automation, cloud modernization, and API-first orchestration across hybrid environments. Proven success in eliminating legacy systems, deploying containerized platforms, and mentoring high-performing teams. Expert in delivering scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions that align with enterprise DevOps strategy.

education.summary: Summa Cum Laude, Phi Beta Kappa

languages.fluency: Monbusho Japanese Language Proficiency Test N1

work.name: The Charles Schwab Corporation
highlights: Created Ansible playbooks for managing Aria Automation Orchestrator security and roles for Redis/Apache Airflow

Retired HP Operations Orchestration ($100K+ savings per annum) and migrated workflows to Aria Automation Orchestrator 8.11/8.14. Led a team of five engineers to rewrite all workflows in Python and establish standards for development tools, shared libraries, testing, and documentation.
Managed and operated automated decommissioning process for over 25,000 legacy TD Ameritrade servers, streamlining infrastructure footprint and reducing operational overhead
Containerized Orchestration API and used Kustomize to automate deployment to Kubernetes, improving scalability and integration
Built SaltStack deployment files for Orchestration API for deployment to traditional servers
Designed RESTful API wrapper for VMware vCenter Orchestrator using Python and Connexion framework
Migrated AppViewX workflows to Aria Automation Orchestrator, eliminating vendor dependency and reducing costs ($100K+ savings per annum)

work.name: TD Ameritrade
highlights: Wrote RESTful API in Python for VM management that inventoried all virtual machines across the enterprise and gave the ability to start/stop/reconfigure the virtual machine
Using Nutanix APIs and vRealize Orchestrator created a workflow/API for self-service restore of virtual desktops

Wrote RESTful API to front-end BMC Remedy so there is no need for a developer or infrastructure engineer to know the intricacies of Remedy forms; instead, they can concentrate on working with familiar objects such as Incidents and Changes
Wrote RESTful API as a wrapper for VMware vCenter Orchestrator 7.4 so that the self-provisioning UI portal team could call the API to spin up and destroy on-demand compute resources
Created a vRealize Orchestrator workflow to create virtual machines on demand saving the company from using expensive products such as CloudBolt
Automated decommissioning of on-demand compute as well as our standard virtual machine environment
Rearchitected our API Gateway infrastructure and API services to use Docker containers and provide better security (running under non-root accounts) and greater resiliency (multiple upstreams)

work.name: TD Ameritrade
work.summary: I initially worked with the Windows Server Operations team provisioning servers for our newest datacenter. While in this position, colleague and I worked together automating pieces of the server provisioning process using VBScript, PowerShell, and C# depending on circumstances. Eventually I started specializing in the VMware Operations space. At the time we had started using ESX 3.5 and eventually moved from 3.5 -> 4.0 -> 5.0 while in this role.

work.name: Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria, S.A.
work.summary: Provided systems support and automation guidance for global banking infrastructure. Assisted in server provisioning, performance optimization, and hybrid environment maintenance.

work.name: TPG Axon
work.summary: Delivered IT support and infrastructure automation for hedge fund operations. Supported virtualization, storage, and network services in high-performance trading environments.

work.name: Soleil Securities
work.summary: Managed infrastructure for an independent equities research firm. Introduced scripting and automation to streamline server and desktop support, and maintained Active Directory and SQL Server environments.

work.name: Credit Suisse First Boston
work.position: Assistant Vice President, Business Support Group
work.summary: I began my IT career at Credit Suisse in a Help Desk position after obtaining my MCSE (NT 4.0) certification. After six months I moved on to Desktop Support and then ended my tenure there as part of an Escalations Team acting as a liaison between Engineering and Desktop Support
